properties.otherAdvice:
Good Things Music Festival at Brazilian Fields, Centennial Park from 12pm to 10pm.

With more than 20,000 music fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual in the area as crowds travel to and from the festival.

Sections of Driver Ave, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd will close from 9pm until 11:30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will also be in place from 11am until 11pm on key roads in Surry Hills and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
The following roads will be closed in Centennial Park and Moore Park:

FROM 9PM TO 11:30PM

  • ​​Driver Avenue between ​Lang Road​ and ​the southern turning circle​ (both directions)
  • ​​Lang Road between Anzac Parade and ​Errol Flynn Boulevard (both directions)
  • Lang Road between ​Moore Park Road​ and ​Mitchell Street (both directions)
  • Moore Park Road between Oxford Street and Lang Road (westbound)
  • Moore Park Road* between Oatley Road and Regent Street (eastbound)
  • Moore Park Road* between Regent Street and Gordon Street (eastbound)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Oxford Street (eastbound)

*Managed access to/from the Entertainment Quarter

(Mid Western Highway) will be closed between Brisbane Street and the Imperial Hotel (east of Lachlan St). Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.
properties.diversions: Motorists will be detoured via Fitzroy Street, Vaux Street and Lachlan Street. The diversion is suitable for all vehicles.

roads.mainStreet: Mid Western Highway

properties.otherAdvice: The Millthorpe Markets will take place at Redmond Oval, Millthorpe on Sunday 4 December between 8:30am and 3:00pm. A reduced speed limit of 40 km/h will be in place on Millthorpe Road (Park St) between Victoria Street and Richards Lane. Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.

roads.mainStreet: Millthorpe Road

properties.otherAdvice: The annual Warren Christmas Street Party will take place on Dubbo Street at Warren on Friday 2 December between 6:00pm and 9:30pm. The Oxley Highway will be closed between Dubbo Street and Cobb Lane. Motorists should allow additional travel time and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.
properties.diversions: Light vehicles will be detoured via Thornton Avenue, Readford Street and Lawson Street. Heavy vehicles will be detoured via Industrial Access Road.

roads.mainStreet: Oxley Highway

Alison Road will be closed between the Pacific Highway and Hely Street.

Turn movements from the Pacific Highway into Alison Road will be restricted.

Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.

Sections of Harbour St at the Stadium will be closed for crowd safety. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Women: Sydney FC v Brisbane Roar from 5.05pm and A-League Men: Sydney FC v Melbourne City at Allianz Stadium from 7:45pm, finish around 9:35pm.

With thousands of football fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3.45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, or from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Kippax car park will not be open for the match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

Art for all in the Gardens at the Phillip Precinct in the Domain from 7pm to 10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD on Macquarie St, College St and William St. Motorists should allow extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

Art Gallery Rd will be closed to incoming traffic from 7pm. 

Closures will also be in place on the following roads from approx 9:30pm to allow traffic to leave the event safely. 

  • St Mary’s Rd from Prince Albert Rd to Sir John Young Cr
  • Prince Albert Rd from Macquarie St to Art Gallery Rd
  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl
  • Macquarie St from Hunter St to Prince Albert Rd
  • St James Rd from Elizabeth St to Macquarie St
  • College St from Park St to Prince Albert Rd
  • Cathedral St at St Marys Rd

A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

With thousands of fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD on Macquarie St, College St and William St. Motorists should allow extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

Art Gallery Rd will be closed to incoming traffic from 7pm both evenings.

Closures will also be in place on the following roads from approx 10pm to allow traffic to leave the event safely.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Newcaslte Jets. Game starts at 3pm, finish around 5pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the match and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area

properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney's Open for Lunch event will be held along the George St light rail tracks from 12pm to 3pm on Friday.

George St will be closed between Park St and Hunter St while the event is underway. Light rail services will not run from 7.30pm Thursday until 1am Saturday.

Motorists can continue to travel east and west of the city via King St and Market St.

Be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area while the event is underway,

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access will be in place as large crowds celebrate New Year's Eve in Dee Why.

Roads at Dee Why Beach will be closed from 4pm to 10pm:

  • Howard Ave between The Strand and Clyde Road and
  • The Strand between Oaks Ave and Dee Why Pde. 

Access will be maintained for residents on Howard Ave only.

Special event clearways will be effect on the western side of The Strand between Oaks Ave and Dee Why Pde from 12pm midday until 10pm.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Road closures, clearways and restricted access will be in place as large crowds celebrate New Year's Eve at Manly Wharf.

Roads around Manly wharf will be closed from 5pm to 10:30pm including sections of Belgrave St, Eustace St, Gilbert St, Wentworth St, West Promenade, East and West Esplanade and Victoria Pde.

Local access will be maintained for Victoria Pde and Wentworth St residents.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of East and West Esplanade, Belgrave St, Pittwater Rd and West Promenade between 1pm and 10pm.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
With big crowds expected the city is no place for cars this New Year’s Eve with significant road closures and parking restrictions in effect across the city, as well as in North Sydney, Milsons Point and Pyrmont.

In the Sydney CBD, some roads start closing from as early as 4am with roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks closed by 2pm, followed by major closures in the city centre and Pyrmont by 7pm.

The Sydney Harbour Bridge will be completely closed in both directions from 11pm ahead of the midnight fireworks. The Anzac Bridge citybound lanes will close from 8.30pm to 9.30pm and again from 11pm to 1.30am for both firework displays.

Key road closure timings on New Year’s Eve

  • 4am: Macquarie St north of Bridge St
  • 5am: roads in the Royal Botanic Garden & Domain including Art Gallery Rd.
  • 8am: Cahill Expressway northbound. Note Cahill Expressway southbound will already be closed from Boxing Day 26 December.
  • 12pm: Hickson Rd from Millers Point to Barangaroo.
  • 2pm: roads north of Bridge St at Circular Quay including George St/Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Phillip, Young, Pitt and Loftus Streets, and Upper Fort St at Observatory Hill.
  • 5pm: Railway Colonnade at Central Station
  • 6pm: Wheat Rd at King St Wharf, and Darling Island Rd at Pyrmont. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Walkway and Cycleway will be closed from 6pm to 2am.
  • 7pm: Major roads in the CBD centre between York St and Macquarie St from Circular Quay to Hyde Park, roads in The Rocks including Argyle St, Harrington St, Cumberland St and sections of Hickson Rd, and Pirrama Rd in Pyrmont.
  • After 7pm there will be no access to Harbour St from the Harbour Bridge, use York St or Glebe Off-ramps. For access to Darling Harbour continue via Sussex St.
  • 8pm: Darling Drive from Pyrmont Bridge Rd to Pier St
  • 8.30pm - 9.30pm: citybound lanes on the Anzac Bridge and Western Distributor
  • 10pm: roads in Millers Point including sections of Kent St, Windmill St, Argyle St and Lower Fort St.
  • 10pm: roads between Wynyard and Town Hall including sections of York St and Clarence St between Margaret St and Druitt St.
  • 11pm - 1.30am: Sydney Harbour Bridge closed in both directions, Anzac Bridge closed citybound, and Western Distributor fully closed between Pyrmont and the city. Roads in CBD West also closed including Sussex St and Kent St, and all roads in King St Wharf. Additional closures in CBD South around Hyde Park including sections of Liverpool, Pitt, Castlereagh and Elizabeth Streets, sections of roads around Central station also closed.

Most roads reopen between 1.30am and 4am on New Year's Day.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on most major roads throughout the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont from 6am on NYE until 4am on NYD. These clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Major roads including Sydney Harbour Bridge and Anzac Bridge citybound

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 6,000 motorcyclists will take part in the annual Newcastle Toy Run charity cycle riding from Stockton to Wickham.


Riders will leave Stockton Foreshore around 10am and head to Wickham Park via Mitchell St, Fullerton St, Nelson Bay Rd, Teal St (over Stockton Bridge), Cormorant Rd, Tourle Rd, Industrial Dr, Hannell St, Branch St and Albert St to finish at Connolly Park, Wickham by 11:30am where a post-ride event will be held until the afternoon.


Lane closures will be in place along the route on Nelson Bay Rd and Industrial Dr to assist riders between 10am and 11.30am. Roads around Wickham Park including Albert St between Maitland Rd and John St will be closed from 6am until 4pm.


Motorists should be aware of increased motorcycle traffic in Newcastle on Sunday morning, allow additional travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers.

roads.mainStreet: Wharf Road

properties.publicTransport: Event attendees are encouraged to use public transport, with North Wollongong station located a short walk from the venue.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 5000 attendees are expected for the North Gong Pub Santa Pub Crawl on Saturday 10 December. 1 of 3 southbound lanes will be closed on the Princes Highway at North Wollongong with a reduced 40km/h speed limit.

Motorists driving in the area should reduce speed and allow extra travel time.
properties.displayName: North Gong Hotel Santa Pub Crawl

roads.mainStreet: Princes Highway
